name: Introduction to Digital Humanities
description: Digital Humanities (DH) studies human culture -- art, literature, history, geography, religion -- using computational tools and methodologies, and at the same time studies digital technologies and communities through humanist lenses, as complex cultural objects shaped by wider social and political concerns and the ways we construct knowledge and meaning.
prerequisites: 4 FCEs at the 100 level, at least 1 FCE of which must be in Humanities
